title: Social Arts Education Instructional Design for Online Elementary School Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the field, foundational understanding of elementary education curricula and socio-cultural education
context.additional_context: Curriculum reconstructing arts education’s practical/experiential characteristics in online environments based on Signature Pedagogies. Focuses on designing activities to enhance learners’ cultural diversity understanding and social interaction skills

learning_goals: In online settings, signature pedagogy in art education (practice, critique, collaborative creation) is applied to design lessons reflecting sociocultural contexts.

Learners implement three online art education activities (e.g., cultural comparison collage, community-themed collaborative creation, historical art style analysis) using digital tools (Adobe Premiere, Google Workspace, etc.) and submit an improved report (3 pages) incorporating peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

Within four weeks, learners create online instructional materials (3 interactive worksheets, 1 virtual gallery) reflecting elementary students’ (grades 3–6) art learning characteristics (visual engagement, interactivity, simplified concept explanations) and socioemotional development stages. They must achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least four of the five expert feedback criteria: creativity, cultural diversity reflection, interactivity, etc.

resources: LMS (Learning Management System) platforms (Zoom Breakout Rooms, Padlet, Google Jamboard)
Art practice kits (material packages with delivery options)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
